reviewText: All I can say is WOW! For anyone who is a fan of Frank Sinatra, his movies or his music, this DVD set is amazing and you will be hard pressed to find anything as complete as this. On top of this the quality of the recordings were high grade and you get to see Sinatra at his best and of course you get to hear him sing in some of them as well. There is a great book that comes with the set as well that has some great images on it too which again shows Sinatra in the prime of his life. This was an amazing DVD set that I would highly recommend for anyone who was or is a fan of Sinatra, you will not be disappointed!

The 10 films are:  The Pride And The Passion / Kings Go Forth / A Hole In The Head  / Can-Can / The Manchurian Candidate (1962) / Von Ryan's Express / Cast A Giant Shadow / Tony Rome / The Detective / Lady In Cement.  A fine collection for the money, hopefully all letterboxed.
About 50% good films, others so-so. The one about the Cannon in Spain is a turkey. Who would believe an Italian could butcher a Spanish accent?
Great collection of movies! I'm a big fan of Sinatra's PI/cop films, so this doesn't disappoint!
I bought this for my granddaughter who's a big fan of Sinatra's music. She didn't know he was an actor, as well. She was over the moon for this.

Sinatra, what more is there to be said?

The quality of the video and audio made it appear as if it had been produced just yesterday!
LIKE IT
Great old movies:  Tony Rome and the Girl in Cement are excellent.
Excellent film collection, Brings our memories back to present. Thank you to be so good choosing these movies.
Its Sinatra how could it be bad!
I only watched one DVD so far, but that one stalled and skipped so much that I don't know if it was all there.
Excelente
Very Good, My wife loved it .
Love this set!!!!

Have only watched 4 of the movies so far, but one of the discs skips.  These are supposed to be brand new.  Waiting until I watch them all to identify any others for return.  Such a hassle.  Not happy.
A great set of movies for the family to enjoy!

if you are a sinatra fan you'll love these films. the pride and the passion isn't any better than it was way back when, but it's still a treat to watch old blue eyes and grant interact and ogle the lovely sophia loren. sinatra wasn't very believable with the spanish accent when the film was first released and believe it or not, that hasn't improved with age:)
Quality of transfer to digital is very good, sound is good. Still making my way thru the collection...

My boyfriend's a big Sinatra fan, so I bought this as part of his anniversary gift. It's great! It came earlier than expected and the movies are entertaining. The only problem was some of the discs were out of place when I got open the package, but they weren't broken!
Arrived quickly and as described.

Delivers the goods. Each of the10 dvd's has its own slot in one of the two folding cardboard cases which then slide into a single 'outer' case that takes the shelf space of TWO dvd's. I just wish they had included "Come Blow Your Horn"  instead of "Cast a Giant Shadow" - which is really a Kirk Douglas movie with a Sinatra cameo appearance (check the imdb.com cast list). If you are a Frank-Fan, and you have less than four of these movies in your collection, you should consider adding this set.
gift

Excellent films and excellent transfers, but the actual disk manufacturing leaves a lot to be desired.  Most of the discs are either out of balance or have a center hole too large.  Two would not play on my blu-ray, but could be played on my laptop.  One had problems on my blu-ray and was considered a blank disk by my laptop.  All rattled while being played.

I'm a big fan of Sinatra the actor, so this is a must for me, despite the physical disc problem.

I would have given this 10-film set 5 stars were it not for the fact that 3 of the 10 films are not presented in 16x9 anamorphic wide screen. These 3 films are (1) Kings Go Forth (4x3 pan-and-scan; the OAR is 1.85:1), (2) The Pride and the Passion (4x3 letter-boxed; the OAR is 1.85:1), and (3) A Hole in the Head (4x3 letter-boxed; the OAR is 2.35:1). The most egregious of the 3 is clearly A Hole in the Head. On a large-screen TV, the film's image is reduced to a tiny sliver of the screen size.
Some of Frank's better films & some likable comedy.  A great buy for the price if you're a Sinatra fan.
Great DVD content and perfect quality!  These movies are to be watched over and over again for true Sinatra fans.
A fine collection of Sinatra films!
Thank you
He's still the man.
Only for Sinatra fans.
What can I say? I'm a Sinatra-phile.
Worth it just for "Hole in the Head"
Great actor and interesting movies
How can this guy not be rated five, even in death.
The ultimate cool character was Sinatra.  Just his Tony Rome movies, plus Von Ryan's Express were worth the price.
2 of the discs were defective - have not finished them all

The described aspect ratio should be stated as:
The Pride and the Passion 1.62
Kings Go Forth 1.32
A Hole in the Head 2.37
Can-Can 2.1
The Manchurian Candidate 1.76
Von Ryan's Express
Cast a Giant Shadow 2.25
Tony Rome 2.36
The Detective 2.36
Lady in Cement 2.25

One of the DVDs was intermittent in play.

IMHO the cardboard inserts for DVDs is awful, it's difficult to take out and put back each DVD. Also found scratches on the DVDs too.

I am not that familiar with Frank Sinatra's acting.  I was pleasantly surprised.  We have viewed 5 of the movies so far & they were varied and all were quite intertaining.  Sinatra was an actor who could fit in a variety of roles & work well with a variety of other actor in the same movie.

The packaging wasn't the best, but it is ok with me.  The disks played were.
Sinatra is Sinatra no matter what he does and this collection has a wide range of his acting abilities in them it is well worth the price.
A good start guide to Sinatra's best films! An excellent selection of films, including the Von Ryan's Express... I love it!

Poppy loved Frank Sinatra for most of his life. He followed his career and knows every word to his songs. This movie collection keeps my dad engaged. It's a great way for him to enjoy his time. He has Alzheimer's now, but his long-term memory is still in tact and this makes him feel like he is still part of the action. Highly recommend.
Because it was just as perfect as I thought and could not be any more happy with my choice with this collection
Sinatra on DVD, the perfect way to say Merry Christmas to Grandma. This gift will give many hours of reminiscing and pleasure.
I love Sinatra and like him in his later movies. It's nice to be able to see him get better with age.
This is a must have collection for Sinatra fan! It has a great variety of movies! Fantastic price for 10 movies!

Fox has yet put out another great Film Collection of another excellent actor. Five films are MGM's and the other five are Fox's in which Fox is the distributor for most if not all MGM films. As noted by past Fox collections the cases to which the DVD are held in are not the best and can easily be ruined, but I haven't had any problems with any of mine I bought. Here is the list of film included in this collection.

"The Pride and the Passion" (1957/color/132mins/Widescreen)
-Cary Grant, Sinatra, Sophia Loren, Theodore Bikel, John Wengraf; Directed by Stanley Kramer
"Kings Go Forth" (1958/b&w/110mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Tony Curtis, Natalie Wood, Leora Dana, Karl Swenson, Ann Codee; Directed by Delmer Daves
"A Hole in the Head" (1959/color/120mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Edward G. Robinson, Eleanor Parker, Carolyn Jones, Thelma Ritter, Keenan Wynn, Joi Lansing, James Komack; Directed by Frank Capra
"Can-Can" (1960/color/142mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Shirley MacLaine, Maurice Chevalier, Louis Jourdan; Directed by Walter Lang
"The Manchurian Candidate" (1962/b&w/126mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Laurence Harvey, Janet Leigh, Angela Lansbury, Henry Silva, James Gregory, Leslie Parrish; Directed by John Frankenheimer
"Von Ryan's Express" (1965/color/117mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Trevor Howard, Raffaella Carr, Brad Dexter, Sergio Fantoni, John Leyton, Wolfgang Preiss, Adolfo Celi; Directed by Mark Robson
"Cast A Giant Shadow" (1966/color/146mins/Widescreen)
-Kirk Douglas, Senta Berger, Angie Dickinson, James Donald, Luther Adler, Gordon Jackson, Jeremy Kemp, guest starring; Yul Brynner, John Wayne, Frank Sinatra; Directed by Melville Shavelson
"Tony Rome" (1967/color/110mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Jill St. John, Richard Conte, Gena Rowlands, Simon Oakland; Directed by Gordon Douglas
"The Detective" (1968/color/114mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Lee Remick, Ralph Meeker, Jack Klugman, Horace McMahon, Robert Duvall; Directed by Gordon Douglas
"Lady in Cement" (1968/color/93mins/Widescreen)
-Sinatra, Raquel Welch, Richard Conte, Martin Gabel, Lainie Kazan; Directed by Gordon Douglas

Overall this is a great collection of some of the best Frank Sinatra films and I would recommend it to anyone interested in Sinatra films or old films period.
Frank Sinatra was a great actor, most of his films were perfection or close to it. These films in this collection are some of his best, I highly recommend buying this. You won't be sorry.

10 DVD's...this collection is absolutely wonderful! It has a really great variety of movies, from serious ones such as The Manchurian Candidate to fun and light hearted such as Can Can. You will not be sorry!
Always have time for Frank no matter what the subject.  Can't wait for 'The Naked Runner' to be released on DVD.  Must be one of the best spy thrillers ever made.

I know it's a bit churlish to complain about 10 discs for $20, the current CostCo price, but I will anyway because it's another example of Fox's deceitful marketing practices. They, almost alone among DVD releasers, avoid specifying the quality level of their discs. This set contains some fine films, but they are a mix of (appropriately) fullscreen, non-anamorphic widescreen, and anamorphic widescreen. This won't matter if you watch movies on your phone, but, the bigger your display, the more crucial it becomes. Some of the films, like Can-Can, are anamorphic, and a bargain at this price. But some, like The Pride and the Passion, a near-epic, are not only non-anamorphic, but 2.4:1 to boot, meaning that the actual bit-rate used to create the picture is about a third of what you would normally expect. A Hole in the Head is another in this category. Cast A Giant Shadow, Tony Rome, The Detective, and Lady in Cement are anamorphic. I haven't watched the others yet.

What a great find this one was I've been slowly picking up some of Frank's movies as I came acrross them I have most of the rat pack ones but then I saw this. This is a great collection of Frank's movies a total of ten movies covering all areas of his acting from some of the musicals to the dramas then three of the delightful Tony Rome movies forget all those TV guys these are great. Not only was Frank one of the greatest singers of all time but he was a great actor with a wonderful body of work many right here in this collection . Starting your and this guy can act collection? This is a good start some down right wonderful movies. You just can't do wrong with this one.

I mainly got this set for the Tony Rome movies. But this collection gives you wide range of Sinatra movies. From wonderful comedies like a Hole in the Head to powerful dramatic roles like the Manchurian Candidate. Musicals like the Can-Can and war movies like Von Ryan's Express and detective moves like Tony Rome. If you want a set of Sinatra movies that gives you an overview of his talents this is a good set to have. 10 great movies at a great price. Nice package and a great price and Sinatra in some of his most diverse roles.

Not one disc played without interruption.
The quality is poor.  The seller should be embarrassed by this product.
Cool selection. We love old films. Nice packaging too!
Great blue eyes collection.

Out of all the DVD's in this set not one played from start to finish, they seized up before the end and I had to cut power to my DVD player to get the disk out of the machine. I would have liked to see the end of the movies that I didn't know Sinatra made. I liked the diversity. There was Frank as a cowboy, a detective, a Spanish revolutionary and more. Frank really had range. What I could watch was very different and entertaining. Frank had good movies with other big name movie stars like Sophia Loren and John Wayne.
This would have been a prized collection if it didn't lock up my DVD player. I don't recommend buying this box set. If you want to make sure you get to see the whole movie, buy the titles individually.
Arrived on time. No package damage. I have watched all of the DVDs twice. No problems. So glad that I bought this collection.
I love the whole set .. awesome color awesome films I hadnt seen .. thank u so much !!!!
Some of these films are very dated.  They are definitely not his best.

Here's a list of all the film's you get in this beautiful box set:
The Pride and the passion, Kings go forth, A hole in the head, can-can, the Manchurian candidate, Von Ryan's Express, Cast a giant shadow, Tony Rome, the Detective, & Lady in cement.
  A beautiful box set that's well worth the price; I have not seen a better deal on a set of Frank's film's than what I got here- a must for every Sinatra fan!!
a delight
I bought this for my wife as a birthday gift and she loves it. There is a great variety of movies. It was well worth the price.
